plot_arc.setup: Della and Jim, a loving but impoverished married couple, each secretly resolves to buy the other a meaningful Christmas gift despite their lack of money.
plot_arc.conflict: Della sells her prized long hair to buy Jim a chain for his treasured watch; unbeknownst to her, Jim, struggling with his own lack of funds, sells his watch to buy jeweled combs for her hair.
plot_arc.climax: When gifts are exchanged, both realize their sacrifices have rendered the gifts practically useless but deeply meaningful.
plot_arc.resolution: Della and Jim embrace, recognizing that their selfless love is more valuable than any material gift, reinforcing the true spirit of giving.

characters.name: Della
characters.arc: Gives up her most valued possession for love, realizing that true devotion surpasses material wealth.

characters.name: Jim
characters.arc: Sells his treasured watch for his wife's happiness, understanding the depth of their mutual sacrifice.

characters.name: Hair Dealer
characters.arc: Facilitates Della’s sacrifice, representing the transactional nature of her choice.

critical_moments: Della discovers she has only $1.87 and decides to sacrifice her hair.
Della sells her hair and buys a platinum chain for Jim.
Jim returns, revealing his shock and the combs he bought for Della.
Gifts are exchanged; both realize the ironic futility yet deep meaning of their presents.
They embrace, recognizing that their greatest gift is the love they share.
character_dynamics: Della and Jim’s marriage is built on deep mutual devotion and the willingness to sacrifice personal treasures for the other.
Their parallel acts of self-sacrifice highlight their unity, while the resulting irony strengthens their bond.
Interaction with the hair dealer is impersonal, underscoring the emotional significance of Della’s sacrifice in contrast with the world's indifference.
